meanings.definition: A large bundle of goods, typically wrapped in burlap or plastic.
meanings.sent1: The farmer stacked the bales of hay neatly in the barn.
meanings.sent2: The delivery truck carried bales of cotton to the textile factory.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the bales of straw were a fort in their game.
meanings.sent4: The bales of newspapers in the recycling bin towered like a city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of the bales of fresh grass filled the air at the farm.

meanings.sent3: He bales the leaves in the yard to keep them tidy.
meanings.sent4: The machine bales the shredded paper quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent5: They bale the old clothes to donate to charity every year.
